ejb

Class UserSSB

  • java.lang.Object
    • ejb.UserSSB

  • public class UserSSB
extends java.lang.Object
    The UserSSB provides access to the user database entries, all code in the rest of the project accesses user data in the database through this class.

      UserSSB()

    • Method Detail

      • addUser

        public boolean addUser(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String username,
              java.lang.String password,
              java.lang.String phoneNumber)
        This method adds a user to the database.
        Parameters:
        name - user's name
        username - user's username
        password - user's password: The user's password is encrypted using the encryptPassword(password) method prior to storing.
        phoneNumber - user's telephone number
        Returns:
        ture when the user is added. otherwise return false.

      • getAllUsers

        public java.util.List<AppUser> getAllUsers()
        This method returns all the current users stored in the database
        Returns:
        list of all AppUsers representing users stored in the database.

      • getUser

        public AppUser getUser(java.lang.String username)
        This method a specific user with the username passed as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        username - of the user that we want.
        Returns:
        AppUser representing the user.

      • checkPassword

        public boolean checkPassword(java.lang.String username,
                    java.lang.String password)
        checks that a user has a specific password. The username passed as a parameter along with the unencrypted password is compared to the database to check that the users details are correct.
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user
        password - the password of the user
        Returns:
        true if the user's details are correct, false if not.

      • doesUsernameExist

        public boolean doesUsernameExist(java.lang.String username)
        This method checks if the user with the username, passed as a parameter, exists on the database.
        Parameters:
        username - the username that we want to look up.
        Returns:
        true if the user with that username exists on the database.

      • getUserByPhoneNumber

        public AppUser getUserByPhoneNumber(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
        This returns a user based on their phone number passed as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        phoneNumber - of th user we want
        Returns:
        AppUser representing the user with the phone number passed as a parameter.

      • encryptPassword

        public java.lang.String encryptPassword(java.lang.String plainTextPassword)
                                 throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        This method encrypts our plain text password to an encrypted password to be stored on the database. The method makes use of the one way hash function, specifically SHA-265 prototcol.
        Parameters:
        plainTextPassword - the plaintext password
        Returns:
        string representation of the encrypted password
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
